result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old) and the other charge, Operating w/PAC-Passenger < 16 Yrs (3rd) was dismissed by the court.

  • Antonio G Scaffidi was found guilty of OWI (3rd w/ Passenger < 16 Yrs Old), an unclassified felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: BAIL APPLIED OF $1,715.00. Remaining balance of $562.00 to be paid at a rate of $50.00 per month commencing 2/01/2015.
BAIL APPLIED TO COSTS. Blood draw costs to be forwarded to Waukesha County Sheriff's dept.

With Huber - FORTHWITH.
Credit for 2 days.

Release for work, treatment and childcare.
DAY REPORT CENTER - 3 months consecutive to Huber sentence, good time not allowed.
If Defendant successfully completes Day Report, the 3 MONTHS of Huber STAYED will be permanently STAYED.
Ignition Interlock to be installed on every vehicle TITLED OR REGISTERED to the defendant.
Defendant completed Victim Impact Panel on 10/08/14.

Count 2 was dismissed outright.
Case 14TR5057 was dismissed and read into 14CF967.
Follow through with AODA Assessment.

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Antonio G Scaffidi in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The Defendant enters a plea of guilty to Count #1 of the complaint.  The Court find the Defendant guilty on Count #1. Count #2 is dismissed by operation of law.    
  The defendant was sentenced to the following:

HUBER:  10 MONTHS, LAST 3 MONTHS STAYED. Release for work, treatment and childcare.  (Credit - 2 days).  Sentence to begin forthwith.

DAY REPORT CENTER:  3 MONTHS, Consecutive to Huber sentence.  Good time not allowed on DRC.  If defendant successfully completes Day Report Center, the 3 MONTHS of Huber stayed will be permanently stayed. 

FINE: $2277.00(to be paid at $50.00 per month commencing February 1, 2015.  After the Defendant has completed his Huber sentence the payment is to be increased to $500.00 per month, or serve 45 days jail, consecutive, as penalty for non payment of fine);

DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00, to be paid as part of payment plan as listed for fine.   The Defendant is to provide a DNA sample if not yet provided.  Defendant to pay surcharge.

BLOOD DRAW FEE:  $35.00 paid through Waukesha County Circuit Court to be forward to Waukesha County Sheriff's Department, to be paid as part of payment plan as listed for fine. 

DL REVOCATION: 48 months;

IGNITION INTERLOCK: 48 months;

Defendant to attend a Victim Impact Panel.  The Defendant completed the panel on 10/8/14.

Other:  AODA ASSESSMENT AND FOLLOW THROUGH.

The Court grants the vehicle exemption on the 1993 Cadillac..

Court received information from Wisconsin Community Services regarding defendant's compliance/non-compliance.
Plea/sentencing hearing on January 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.

Defendant Antonio G Scaffidi in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Barbara A. Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense is not challenging the prelim.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED by Defense. Defense requests a date after the holidays for a plea/sentence.  
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 12, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
5 exhibits - Exhibit 2 and 3 ordered to be sealed and scanned confidential
filed by Defense
Wisconsin Community Service compliance letter received and filed.
Arraignment on November 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Antonio G Scaffidi in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Lindsey Hirt appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files exhibit 1 marked and received. Deputy Scott K. from the Waukesha County Sheriff's Department was sworn and testified on behalf of the State. State presents exhibits 2 and 3, marked and received. Cross examination by the defense. Defense counsel presents exhibit 4, marked and received. State presents exhibit 5, marked and received. State rests. No testimony by the defense. State moves for bind over. Defense objects and presents arguments and moves to dismiss. Court finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds the defendant over for trial. (Exhibits 2 and 3 are to be sealed)  Arraignment scheduled for November 20, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing on October 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.

Defendant Antonio G Scaffidi in court with attorney Christopher J. Cherella.  Abbey Nickolie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Preliminary Hearing requested.  Preliminary time limits waived.  Bail remains as fixed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for October 24, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Hearing on September 22, 2014 at 08:15 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
Hearing on September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.

Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.    Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services (WCS) Intoxicated Driver Program immediately after his release.  Defendant is not to operate a motor vehicle unless properly licensed.
Waukesha County Pretrial Screening Services Report by Wisconsin Community Services filed.

Defendant Antonio G Scaffidi in court, in custody, with attorney Joan B Broughton as friend of the court.   Lesli S. Boese appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant allowed non-collect calls.  Court tolled time limits for preliminary hearing for the status of counsel.  Hearing scheduled for September 15, 2014 at 10:00 am.
